metadata.Title: CVE-2013-4243 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Heap-based buffer overflow in the readgifimage function in the gif2tiff tool in libtiff 4.0.3 and earlier allows remote attackers to cause a denial of service (crash) and possibly execute arbitrary code via a crafted height and width values in a GIF image.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2013-4243` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libtiff-opengl - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.1
libtiff-tools - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.1
libtiff5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.1
libtiffxx5 - 4.0.3-7ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: jdstrand> per Debian, tiff3 source package doesn't build the TIFF tools mdeslaur> as of 2014-03-10, no upstream fix yet

criterions.comment: tiff package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.0.3-7ubuntu0.1').
